name: wearefrank
description: A plugin to help users with the development of their Frank!Framework integrations!

walkthroughs.title: Get Started with Frank!Framework
walkthroughs.description: This walkthrough shows you how the Frank!Framework extension helps you create, configure, run, and understand Frank projects.

steps.title: Open or Create a Frank Project
steps.description: In the Activity Bar, open the Frank!Framework Welcome view. From here you can either open an existing Frank project or create a new one. When creating a new project you can choose from a few options. The Simple Frank option creates a simple project, the other options will take you to their respective GitHub pages. When choosing the Simple Frank option, you will be asked to give the new project and configuration a name.

steps.title: Run Your Project
steps.description: Run your project using Ant, Docker, or Docker Compose from the Frank!Start view in the Explorer. At the top you'll see the current project, choose your start method and hover over it to reveal the button to run it.

steps.title: Run Previous Projects Again
steps.description: Previously run projects are saved so you can easily start them again from the Frank!Start view.

steps.title: Run with Ant and Choose FF! Version
steps.description: When running a project with Ant, you can choose which version of FF! the Frank!Runner uses: the highest version available online, the highest stable version online or a version already locally installed. Right-click on a project in the Frank!Start view to view and choose an option.

steps.title: Visualize Your Configuration
steps.description: When working with a Frank configuration file, the flowchart is shown in the Secondary Sidebar. It visualizes how your configuration works and updates automatically when you save changes or switch between configuration files.

steps.title: Use Built-in Snippets
steps.description: Snippets are automatically loaded from the Frank!Framework Wiki. Each component has at least one snippet, and some have multiple. Start typing the component name to see available snippets and insert them into your configuration.

steps.title: Create a Custom Snippet
steps.description: Select text in the editor, right-click, and choose “Add Frank! Snippet”. Enter a name to save the selected text as your own snippet.

media.altText: Create a Frank snippet from selected text

steps.title: View Your Snippets
steps.description: Available snippets are shown in the Frank!Snippets view in the Explorer. Snippets are grouped into your custom snippets and snippets from the Frank!Framework wiki. Within each group, snippets are further organized by name, and each group can contain multiple snippets. Click a snippet to insert it into your editor.

media.altText: Frank Snippets view in the Explorer

steps.title: Manage and Edit User Snippets
steps.description: Click a custom snippet name to open the management view. Here you can rename collections, edit snippet prefixes, descriptions, and content, add new snippets, or delete existing ones. If you want to share a snippet with others, use the button in the top right to submit it to the Frank!Framework Wiki.

media.altText: Manage user snippets in the webview

steps.title: Open Component Documentation
steps.description: Components with available documentation are underlined in the editor. Hold Ctrl (or Cmd on macOS) and click the component name to open its Frank!Doc page in your browser.

viewsWelcome.contents:
Welcome to the Frank!Framework!
The Frank!Framework is an easy-to-use, stateless integration framework which allows (transactional) messages to be modified and exchanged between different systems.
[Open a Frank](command:vscode.openFolder)
[Create a Frank](command:frank.createNewFrank)
For an introduction:
 [Open Walkthrough](command:frank.openWalkthrough)
